org.strongback.components

Interface Switch

  • All Known Subinterfaces:
    Fuse
    Functional Interface:
    This is a functional interface and can therefore be used as the assignment target for a lambda expression or method reference.

    @ThreadSafe
 @FunctionalInterface
public interface Switch
    A switch is any readable device that has an active state when it is triggered and an inactive state when it isn't.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Static Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods Default Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      static Switch alwaysTriggered()
      Create a switch that is always triggered.
      static Switch and(Switch switch1, Switch switch2)
      Return a new switch that is only triggered when both switches are triggered.
      boolean isTriggered()
      Checks if this switch is triggered.
      static Switch neverTriggered()
      Create a switch that is never triggered.
      static Switch or(Switch switch1, Switch switch2)
      Return a new switch that is only triggered when either switch is triggered.

    • Method Detail

      • isTriggered

        boolean isTriggered()
        Checks if this switch is triggered.
        Returns:
        true if this switch was triggered, or false otherwise

      • alwaysTriggered

        static Switch alwaysTriggered()
        Create a switch that is always triggered.
        Returns:
        the always-triggered switch; never null

      • neverTriggered

        static Switch neverTriggered()
        Create a switch that is never triggered.
        Returns:
        the never-triggered switch; never null

      • and

        static Switch and(Switch switch1,
                  Switch switch2)
        Return a new switch that is only triggered when both switches are triggered.
        Parameters:
        switch1 - the first switch; may not be null
        switch2 - the second switch; may not be null
        Returns:
        the logical AND of the two switches; never null

      • or

        static Switch or(Switch switch1,
                 Switch switch2)
        Return a new switch that is only triggered when either switch is triggered.
        Parameters:
        switch1 - the first switch; may not be null
        switch2 - the second switch; may not be null
        Returns:
        the logical OR of the two switches; never null
